page.title: 06THE RIDGEWAY
page.content:
The Ridgeway is a very old path in Britain. It is 144km long and about 4 metres wide in some places. Most people use it for{recreation}eg.riding horses and walking.
The Ridgeway is also a{historic feature. It was first used in the Bronze Age and later used for taking animals to market, which is why it is wide enough to enable one flock of sheep to pass another.
The{landscape}around is mostly farmland, both arable and pasture.
Many{tourists}visit the Ridgeway either to admire the view, or to walk it. There are small hotels and youth hostels off the Ridgeway, or some people prefer to camp.
